column4: anyone got any success plugging an iPod to a x86 ubuntu system?
i was going to try it soon..... you tried and it didnt work?
well, it does work.....when it wants to :p
elaborate...?:)
I had to rebuild rhythmbox with the --with-ipod option in configure, but I'm having trouble mounting the ipod
the modules sometime work, other thimes don't work
grunf!
If I reboot, probably it will fix, until I unmount the ipod again.....
u use rhythmbox as an itunes clone? not something like gtkpod ?
I use it just to access my music on the iPod, my other computer is an iBook running MacOS X, so I'm actually using iTunes to fill the iPod up
ok
to disconnect the iPod I must umount /mnt/ipod then rmmod sbp2
If I reboot without disconnecting the iPod I'll have troubles after reconnecting it.....AFAIK this has been it's Modus Operandi
my problems with rebooting (other than having to lose a bit os uptime) is that sometimes the machine doesn't boot....
it freezes while running the hotplug init script
after giving me a FATAL: hw_random module error (can't recall the actual text)
i'll try it a little later and tell u what i get if you're still here.... which instructions should i follow to install the ipod stuff? link?
just a sec
let me look for them
http://people.csail.mit.edu/people/adonovan/hacks/ipod.html
http://neuron.com/~jason/ipod_archive.html
http://www.cs.duke.edu/~geha/ipod/
